row.cell:
16 in edge
of meadow 56 meadow 12 wrack on meadow

River when lowest in
April &
April 4-5 6 not yet so high by
4 or 5 feet as last winter

4 with a mark
of river
May 15 (?) but still
prob.up
2 water on meadows

cell.add:
1st been going
down a month at
least

3rd gone down so
that I have to steer
carefully to avoid hummocks on
meadows
23rd just left bare
for blackbirds

row.cell:
May 4 generally
off meads.
fast & very low
29 rapidly going down
shows grass on meadow

12 going down
leaving its wrack
May 1st water
on meads rapidly
going down. am
confined to river for
most part
Say 3rd is quite low ( 14 going down rapidly
Hunt's causeway just bare)

6 3rd rock
more than 1 foot
out & falling to 6th
at least to 9th
say 9th & prob. below summer level

Say 10th
10th spring
freshet ends
began Mar. 8
(not to include the winter
one) 17 up again so that I avert but is further to Mantatuket's rock
but already falling

Lowest for Mar.
the 31st 3 ft. be-
low
H's wall
or 6 1/2 in above
summer level
Lowest ap. 30
or 3+ inches below
- summer level
very low
lowest as yet

River when highest in April
& now high.
(May 31-50 higher)
than it has been at this season
for many years -
water over road below master
Cheney's

10 high, but
not high for
spring
23rd highest for
year 8 1/2 inch
above horizontal truss (i.e. 8 + 7 1/2 inch
above SL)
2" up but falling

7 river raised so that I can cross the
great meadows
9 mead but part-
ially flooded.
say 7 (??) &
not high.

30 highest for April
say 29 & high 24 rises a little owing to rain of 22nd & 23rd
Mar 17 or 29 nearly as high
as anytime in this year
May 5 far highest in
the year very high the year 54 as
year (on ac. of rain
the 3rdand 4th) arches
quite concealed - highest since
23rd-52

14 steadily rising
since 1st
19 fallen a little
21 risen again a little
on ac. of rain
23 at height for this rise
higher than before since
winter whole of Lee Meadow covered
28 rather
& 26th

11 at its height
(v. 23rd)
23rd risen again
over all Hill
23rd
begins to fall
3rd rain at last &
r. rapidly rises
5 over the meads
8 higher 23 nearly as high as 11 can just get over
E. Hosmer's meadow
8th cannot get under
stone bridge

24 at its
height - higher
than before
(22 higher than be-
fore & rising ---
cut off great bends &
fairly go over Hub B.
causeway)
owing to melting snow

14 a little higher
on ac. of rain
but no rise of con
sequence
Say 14 (?) but quite low (?)

1st to Assabet
over meads in boat
10 cannot cross meads
28 Great Meadow partly over X with B & B Say 1st (?) I go to
rock in boat again

rises some slightly
from Ap. 7 to 14th
falls from 15th to end
being 1/2 inch above
summer level
the 24th at summer level 26th ...
highest the 14th
for Ap. but very little
on meads.

15 still cloudy day
water smooth & full of
reflections
5th or 6th?

Mar 26th
Ap. 13 - hear toads
& take off in Haverhill

Mar 17
too warm
in one
Ap 25 begin to take
off
April 5 & 6 take off

16
1st regret wearing
great coat
17 18 - & 19 get warmer
& go without greatcoat

7th & 8 warm
enough to leave off
put it on when I
leave boat
9th leave it

Feb. 25
(65+°
left at home - single
coat too much

7
6 & 7th
put on
great coat again
after a week of warm
weather

Mar. 17 wear
but one --
weather for half-thick
coat 27th & 30th

cell.emph: begin to wear one coat generally

row.cell:
19-60
wear but 1 coat the last
10 days of Ap.

cell.del:
20 begin to sit
without fires more
commonly

cell.emph: first am that I sit with open window

row.cell:
Burning of brush
v winter Mar 30)

cell.emph: Fires in woods late in month

row.cell:
21) May 4th dry leaves in woods
time for fires May 6 about end
of very dry leaves

cell.emph: Plowing a little and planting going on generally

still almost sultry - with
wet looking clouds hanging
about - 1st time

row.cell:
3 1st time but
not so warm as
Mar. 17th

6th pretty foggy
for several morn
ings

cell.emph: Cold in last half of month

row.cell:
24
cold NW
wind no frogs out
& for 3 or 4 days

18 5 days storm
begins after & with
E wind

13-14 snow &
rain after E wind
the 7th (beginning 18 Mar
followingan E. wind
another 22)

May 1st platforms white with
5 wets feet

cell.emph:
Very few leaves indeed on
young oaks

Begin to sit without fire
commonly
